column4: If I had a retailer custom construct my computer for me, where would i find from what hardware manufacturer to get drivers from?

If I had a retailer custom construct my computer for me, where would i find from what hardware manufacturer to get drivers from?
you want to know what hardware is in ur machine?
in terminal try : lspci / lsusb, lshw
no, those give me the make and model not the company
normally there would be : ATI or NVIDIA in the names.
- i know its broadcom, i mean where to get drivers
you want to get your wireless card working
- i can do it i just need the right drivers
if you do lshw you get network sections, they should give info on the right wireless pci card
https://help.ubuntu.com/7.10/internet/C/ndiswrapper.html worked like a charm for me
gotta know what wireless card u have :)
download the windows driver and use https://help.ubuntu.com/7.10/internet/C/ndiswrapper.html that worked for me, i thnk i hae a similar card
- i don't have access to the repos
when u wnt to sudo apt-get it u mean?
